oai_dc:dc.dc:title: From Project Management to Process Management - Effectively Organising Transdisciplinary Projects
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Moschitz, Heidrun
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Systems research and participatory research
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In transdisciplinary projects, the roles of researchers change. In addition to being a source of knowledge, they are required to engage in knowledge exchange processes. This results in an alteration at project level: researchers need to creatively manage projects as group processes.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Moschitz, Heidrun (2013) From Project Management to Process Management - Effectively Organising Transdisciplinary Projects. GAIA - Ecological Perspectives for Science and Society, 22 (3), pp. 211-213.
